answers.answer: Hi there,It is important to know a detailed medical history and clinical examination findings before arriving at any diagnosis. High creatinine usually reflects kidney functions. Drinking lots of fluids, regularly exercising, and consuming lots of roughage can help keep creatinine levels in check. A good diet may help in regular detoxification of the blood and reducing the load on the kidneys. High WBC count indicates presence of an infection. It is best to consult your doctor for more details and queries since he knows your medical history best.Do keep me posted on how you are doing.Best luck and regards!

question: For the past few years, my doctors have told me I have elevated creatinine.  Recently, I went to an urgent care and was treated for the stomach flu.  The doctor told me my WBC was elevated, and I also had elevated creatinine and increased liver function (something like that).  He said I was a candidate for diabetes.This week, I followed up with my doctor, and found my WBC was 12.  Could this be related to my kidneys?
title: concerned about WBC
